perturbation.original_text: 1. EXTENSION OF SERVICE AGREEMENT. Subject to all other terms and conditions set forth herein, as of the date of this agreement, LEADER maintain the software for an additional five years.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. EXTENSION OF SERVICE AGREEMENT. Subject to all other terms and conditions set forth herein, as of the date of this agreement, LEADER may maintain the software for an additional five years, pending a performance review after the first year.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that LEADER will maintain the software for an additional five years. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating that LEADER *may* maintain the software, pending a performance review. This creates a contradiction, as the original clause implies a guaranteed extension, while the modified clause makes it conditional and potentially shorter than five years.

perturbation.original_text: 4. GOVERNING LAW. This Agreement and any matters arising out of or related to this Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of Nevada. If any action is brought among the parties with respect to this Agreement or otherwise, by way of a claim or counterclaim, the parties agree that in any such action, and on all issues, the parties irrevocably waive their right to a trial by jury. Exclusive jurisdiction and venue for any such action shall be the State Courts of Nevada.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. GOVERNING LAW. This Agreement and any matters arising out of or related to this Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of Nevada. If any action is brought among the parties with respect to this Agreement or otherwise, by way of a claim or counterclaim, the parties agree that in any such action, and on all issues, the parties irrevocably waive their right to a trial by jury. However, the parties may elect to pursue arbitration as an alternative dispute resolution method. Exclusive jurisdiction and venue for any such action shall be the State Courts of Nevada.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that any action related to the agreement will be governed by Nevada law, and the parties waive their right to a jury trial. The modified version adds that "the parties may elect to pursue arbitration," which contradicts the earlier waiver of the right to a trial by jury and introduces ambiguity about whether disputes will be resolved in court or through arbitration.

perturbation.original_text: 11. ATTORNEYS’ FEES. Each party will pay its or his own legal fees and other expenses in connection with the preparation of this Agreement and the sale of Assets in accordance with this Agreement. However, if any legal action or other proceeding is brought for the enforcement of this Agreement, or because or arising out of an alleged dispute, breach, default or misrepresentation in connection with any of the provisions of this Agreement, the prevailing party will be entitled to recover reasonable attorney’s fees and other costs incurred in that action or proceeding, in addition to any other relief to which it or he may be entitled.
perturbation.changed_text: 11. ATTORNEYS’ FEES. Each party will pay its or his own legal fees and other expenses in connection with the preparation of this Agreement and the sale of Assets in accordance with this Agreement. However, if any legal action or other proceeding is brought for the enforcement of this Agreement, or because or arising out of an alleged dispute, breach, default or misrepresentation in connection with any of the provisions of this Agreement, the court will determine if the prevailing party is entitled to recover reasonable attorney’s fees and other costs incurred in that action or proceeding, in addition to any other relief to which it or he may be entitled.
perturbation.explanation: Originally, the prevailing party *will* be entitled to recover legal fees. The modified version changes this to say the court *will determine if* the prevailing party is entitled to recover fees. This makes the awarding of attorney's fees discretionary rather than mandatory, contradicting the earlier certainty and creating ambiguity about who bears the cost of legal action.
